resources.string: Savor sensational views of Cape Sounion and the sacred Temple of Poseidon. Set out on a thrilling coastal drive along the picturesque Attica Riviera, then marvel at the ruins of the Temple of Poseidon, perched high on the sea cliffs at the tip of the Cape. Learn how the temple was built back in 444 - 440 BC, in honor of the god of the sea; explore the remarkably preserved ruins, including grand marble columns; and gaze out across the Aegean Sea.

The Acropolis of Athens is an ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city of Athens and contains the remains of several ancient buildings of great architectural and historic significance, the most famous being the Parthenon.
The Odeon of Herodes Atticus is a stone theatre structure located on the southwest slope of the Acropolis of Athens, Greece. The building was completed in 161 AD and then renovated in 1950

The Ancient Agora of Classical Athens is the best-known example of an ancient Greek agora. Located to the northwest of the Acropolis, Agora was the heart of ancient Athens, the focus of political, commercial, administrative and social activity, the religious and cultural center and the seat of justice.

Lively Monastiraki is known for iconic landmarks including the ruins of Hadrian’s Library, the Ancient Agora and the rebuilt Stoa of Attalos, with a museum exhibiting Athenian artifacts. Monastiraki Flea Market is a jumble of shops selling artisanal soaps, handmade sandals andsouvenir T-shirts. The surrounding streets are crammed with traditional tavernas and restaurants, many with Acropolis views.

Although the colossal Temple of Olympian Zeus can be seen from the street after all it is one of the largest Classical temples, this is one monument that definitely should be experienced up close. When completed by Hadrian in the 2nd century AD there were 104 columns that made up the temple. Of these, only 16 remain standing today. Besides the temple, there are many other remains on site, including those of a Roman bath house, a basilica, various residences and the remains of the city’s walls.

Telaro Tasting Culture is located in the center of Athens, at St. Irene Square, on the busy pedestrian street of Aiolou. It is a coffee and food spot. It gives particular emphasis on the quality of coffee and the way of preparing, accompanying it with wonderful breakfast choices and other flavors for the beverage you choose
Trata is a traditional fish tavern placed in the heart of athens

From Thanasis Vassilenas’ humble taverna, born in the impoverished neighbourhoods of 1920s Piraeus to a modern, cosmopolitan restaurant in the heart of Athens on Vrasida Street. A culinary story that spans one hundred years. A journey filled with the memories and flavours of family recipes that continue to inspire our cuisine today.
Romantic, Child-friendly, Business meetings, Kids, Special Occasion Dining, Bar Scene, Local cuisine

A local institution, this is the grande dame of Athenian hotels. Whenever heads of state and Hollywood stars come to the Greek capital, this is where they stay. Glamorous rooms, gracious service, an opulent spa and superb rooftop dining have earned the ‘GB’ a place among the world’s best hotels.
geo:0,0?q= Hotel Grande Bretagne, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Athens

The King George, a former royal residence, stands in the heart of Athens with splendid views to the Acropolis,sea and National Gardens. This boutique hotel first opened in 1936 and has since pampered VIPS including Maria Callas, Frank Sinatra and Marilyn Monroe in its 102 rooms and suites.
geo:0,0?q= King George, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Athens
This family-run, luxury boutique hotel sits in the shadow of the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum, taking full advantage of the view from its rooms and at its acclaimed rooftop bar and restaurant.
This well-established luxury hotel rises above an Athens\' main crossroad, boasting one of the best urban panoramic views from its rooms as well as its popular rooftop bar and restaurant.

One of the top luxury boutique stays in Athens, centrally located in posh Kolonaki, with views of the Acropolis and Lycabettus Hill. The hotel sets itself apart by offering unique amenities including a cinema, art gallery and yoga sessions.
